title: How to Make Nut Butter

steps.headline: Choose your favourite kind of nut.
steps.description:
Try out one type or a variety of them. Macadamia nuts
Almonds
Cashews
Pistachios

steps.headline: Toast the nuts in the oven.
steps.description: Place them in a single layer on parchment paper. Bake them at 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) for about 5 to 10 minutes. Just be aware since nuts can burn quickly.

steps.headline: Let the nuts cool down and add them to a food processor.
steps.description: Drizzle a few tablespoons of vegetable oil in the processor and blend. If you want a chunky mixture, blend it for a short time. To get a creamier texture, process it for a longer time. You might want to add a little drizzle of water to make the mixture thinner.

steps.headline: Be unique with spices and condiments.
steps.description: You can either keep it nut/oil natural or add other condiments to the butter. Try vanilla extract, chilli flakes, cinnamon, or maple syrup.

steps.headline: Lightly brush it on snacks, such as crackers or apples.
steps.description: Store any leftovers in an airtight container.

text:
Choose your favourite kind of nut. Try out one type or a variety of them. Macadamia nuts
Almonds
Cashews
Pistachios Toast the nuts in the oven. Place them in a single layer on parchment paper. Bake them at 350 degrees F (180 degrees C) for about 5 to 10 minutes. Just be aware since nuts can burn quickly. Let the nuts cool down and add them to a food processor. Drizzle a few tablespoons of vegetable oil in the processor and blend. If you want a chunky mixture, blend it for a short time. To get a creamier texture, process it for a longer time. You might want to add a little drizzle of water to make the mixture thinner. Be unique with spices and condiments. You can either keep it nut/oil natural or add other condiments to the butter. Try vanilla extract, chilli flakes, cinnamon, or maple syrup. Lightly brush it on snacks, such as crackers or apples. Store any leftovers in an airtight container. Finished.
